title: Riot wants feedback on Yasuo. (Friendly conversations inside pls) What makes him fun/anti fun?
body:
http://www.surrenderat20.net/2017/06/red-post-collection-june-15th-mid-patch.html#more
> *While these numbers certainly aren’t conclusive, nor necessarily indicative of a problem, it’s an interesting note that in the most competitive environment Yasuo actually struggles to find his place on the Rift. 
Our belief is that if we want to get him into a state where he is both viable and also not a must-ban, **we need to tweak more than numbers.** He was already pretty high on our list of champions that we wanted to look at on the scope of a potential ability update (think Rek’sai, Kindred, Heimer etc.), and with the release of 10 bans he’s moved right up alongside some fellow counterparts in Leblanc and Azir. 
I want to stress that we haven’t begun investigation yet as we iterate on some other projects, but we’ll be taking a look at him in the next few weeks.** I’d expect that when we’re done Yasuo will look and feel very similar to now, but with power shifted around on his kit to provide more windows of engaging decision making for his opponents, while maintaining a lot of the agile swordmaster experience he provides today.** Again, we’re thrilled that Yasuo is a champion that gives people who play him something to love, now we just need to find a fair way to have his opponents accept their fate as he steals their last breath with his blade. 
We would love to hear your thoughts on this, actually! **What is it that you love about playing as Yasuo? What is it that you hate when playing against him? Tell us in the comments! **


I'll start by saying i'm not a Yasuo main by any means, I use to play the champion quite often because I did find him fun.

Things I like(d) about Yasuo that have even been hurt, or still exist. (while playing as)
1. E felt very smooth to max
2. Weaving autos between Q's is actually really important
3. E/Q combos. (with flash as well)
4. Trinity/Mallet build.

I know 4 was hated by a lot of people. But i'll explain why later it was fun for me.

Things i don't like, or feel strongly towards keeping/being strong.
1. His feast or famine gameplay. Either he can 1v9, or he puts your team into feeling like its 4v5 with how hard he can feed trying to do his "job"
2. Don't really care about the double crit personally, its fun but his kit is fun without it.
3. His windwall feels overtuned in the sense that, i thought forsure i was casting it late a lot of times as it looked like an ashe arrow was already making contact, but i still manged to block it.
4. The duration he can keep people in the air. (i think the time could be cut in half, makes Yasuo players have to react faster to their knock-up rather then holding it)

Now i'll probably catch a lot of flack for this because Yasuo mains themselves will likely feel strongly in other areas than myself. The reason i liked the Mallet/Trinity build "era" is because it made Yasuo more of a team playing champion. He often grouped with his team because he needed them to help with his damage. Though his damage wasn't garbage, it wasn't nearly as good as the crit/lifesteal build. So in that Regard, i liked the tankier build on him as it also fit with his kit, and play patterns pretty well.

Fluidity is important to me, and so when they started making his E and Q clunky to me, i stopped playing him.. I love the champion but i'm not a 1 trick so i dropped him. 

TLDR: For me.. Make Yasuo's kit less 1v9 or 4v5  and return the fluidity of the champion back to how it was.. Take parts out of his kit that don't need to be there to be successful. IMO the crit part.

This is my opinion, everyone has their own triggers with Yasuo, some hate the windwall the most, some hate the crit the most, others hate the ulti' positioning outside the turret, others hate the E spam etc.. EVERYONE who hates yasuo has their own opinion on this part.

**For me, I hate having Yasuo on my team or the enemy VASTLY because i feel like he makes or breaks the winning conditions more than any other champion in the game. Aka Feast/Famine.**

replies.body:
What makes him so very anti-fun:

- Doesn't have real resources, he can spam his abilities without much care. He never has decision making like "Mmm, should I Q this or not?", "Should I throw my tornado or not?", because he'll be able to Q again in 2 seconds and throw a tornado again in 6.

- His E gives him excessive mobility, making a good Yasuo pretty much immune to skill-shots

- His ultimate favours him under towers, literally the only one that does so. If Rek'Sai misses her ultimate she's not left outside of a tower, she pays for it with her life, Yasuo doesn't unless he dives smack-dab in the middle of the tower.

- His windwall lasts too much for how powerful it is. For comparison, Shen's W blocks solely auto-attacks, yet only lasts 1.5 seconds. On a tank. Not to mention that the fact that the Windwall spawns from within him it means that it can very briefly block skill shots from behind him, which is completely unfair. I'm ok with the fact that it blocks any projectile that hits it smack in the middle, but it has to last less or have a bigger cooldown than it currently does and cannot block things that come up behind the cast. Even Fiora's Riposte has a much longer cooldown (and an actual mana cost) for how little it lasts.

- The fact that he has two passives. I find his shield passive to be ok, if annoying, but his crit passive is completely free and he'd be much easier to balance without it. Riot has claimed many times that it exists in order to have Yasuo not go Tank. So let me get this straight, you give him a passive, on top of another passive, that makes it so that he has to invest less into crit/damage in order to do ~~good~~ great damage so that he buys less tank items? I'm sorry, did I miss something? The last time I checked, having to invest less into damage means that you are free to either invest in even more damage (reaching obscene amounts of damage) OR you can invest into tankyness, so you can apply that free damage more reliably. Wasn't this the reason why he got all those nerfs to his base stats?

Yeah, I'm sure playing Yasuo feels great and fun for the player, but I've NEVER, EVER heard someone say "Oh I'm facing an Yasuo, I'm ok with that". In order for him to become tolerable to play against he needs to have his mobility seriously toned down, given meaningful windows where he's mobile and times where he isn't. As it stands, he never lacks mobility since early game he has minions and late game the dash cooldown is so low that in teamfights he also never lacks mobility. The only time he lacks mobility is early game if he has minion disadvantage, that's it.

Essentially his W needs to be shorter and his E seems fine based on what you said, to me if a champ is good at dodging skill shots with E he doesnt need much help from his W. From what people have said abt yasuo on both sides, the W is overkill.

Yes these are the nerfs.

The buffs would be faster generation on his shield, better overall base stats for a fighter and better base damage on his skills. Because there's no denying his base stats are pretty crap due to how continuously nerfed he was because his kit is so versatile and forgiving, they had to remove stats in order for him to have a weakness at all. 

My original post answers why he's frustrating to play against, what skills should be changed in order to be less frustrating, not how he should be changed to balanced.

> The buffs would be faster generation on his shield, better overall base stats for a fighter and better base damage on his skills. Because there's no denying his base stats are pretty crap due to how continuously nerfed he was because his kit is so versatile and forgiving, they had to remove stats in order for him to have a weakness at all.

I agree with this completely. It would also help Yasuo feel less feast or famine by nature of a fighter.

In order to feel less feat or famine. He needs a clearer and healthier power curve than the current crit item power spike which lacks a weak phase.

Just from seeing him. There is no obvious "yasuo is weak now" as there is with xin zhao who falls off, veigar who is meh early and situational champs who generally scale slower than opposition (weaker mid games).

IMO there are 3 options, note they don't necessarily mean less feast or famine, but can be adjusted to change that:

1.  Strong early, weak mid, strong late. In this case he would have high bases, weak mid game scaling (defensive is optimal) and he'd lack tank shredding capabilities (tanks are mostly strong mid game when they have items, they are his counter here). And a strong lategame when his scalings catch up.

2. Strong early, strong mid, weak late. This is classic xin zhao. He'd be able to destroy champions and sustain his lead. However if he can't close out the game he will become a meat shield. Downside is a timer is placed on him to win before that happens.

3. Classic hyper carry: Weak early, decent mid, strong late. This is all in having the bare minimum bases, decent mid game scaling, high late scaling and item dependency which rewards him greatly when he finally gets them. 


Giving yasuo a clear power curve will not only alleviate his lack thereof, but will allow him to be better balanced around the items he has available.

Yes solely nerfs. Because I honestly think windwall is the 100% true reason Yasuo is hated by so many people. Like the mobility doesn't matter because eventually something hits or he runs out of minions/things to dash to, crit's whatever since randuins, armor, staying out of range exists. I do think, again even the hypercarry portion of his kit could be allowed to stay if his capabilities for defense besides his mobility were gutted.

Wouldn't think any buffs are justified, but there is some argument that you could increase Yasuo's mobility in exchange for adding more actual counterplay/making his windwall not utterly fuck every mage/ADC in the game. Like 100% the fact that autos get blocked bothers me more than any of the abilities that get blocked even with the changes I've suggested.

As for the other question, Nerfing/fixing windwall to be more forgiving QOL to opponents is 100% the only way to fix the most egregious way that Yasuo causes people to hate him without touching numbers. Even if you kept the duration/CD the same, making it so ultimates/ already fired projectiles went through + autos went through makes yasuo far fairer to fight and less frustrating. But it's the only thing besides reworking him, removal of a portion, or touching numbers that I can think of, because even if Yasuo's numbers are atrocious his kit still would be toxic.

What do you think about Yasuo having the 2nd highest deaths per game? Sometimes even the most?

As i said to someone else and at the end of my OP, he seems very feast or famine in the sense that, when he is ahead his tools become overwhelming, but when they are behind they are practically meaningless.

Do you feel this is true, and if so, how do your changes fix this?
Same, maybe lower windwall CD. Just lower duration. Don't think ammo system would work well with the rest of his kit.

You make fair points

my main issue is all his ''free'' stats

his shield is pretty much ''free hp''

even if you poke it you get minion aggro and then you just lost a trade
but you have to do it to win the next trade it's kind of bs

Then there is the double crit, you already pointed at the fact that it reduces the need to invest into damage. But it also lets him get fast power spikes  making it hard to keep him down.

And then there is the ult which gives armorpen kinda similar to his free crit it lessens the need for damage items, in this case last whisper items for example

why does he need all that

Good, thorough analysis. His windwall has always been the biggest pain point for me, so it feels good to see it someone else's list. 

I think your last paragraph is really nice synopsis of the problem, but I want to add a bit to it: there are too many things in his kit that feel VERY unique, to the point that having him in the game at all REALLY changes the dynamic. The feast/famine is part of the problem, but to me, it's just that the impact he has on any given game just from being picked is absurd. You have to play so differently around him, even if he's technically balanced. 

In general, there is such a thing as being TOO different, especially when the burden of playing against it becomes very high for people who did not opt into that interaction. Yasuo may be the only champ that really embodies that, and that's why we see such a strange, inverse power curve for him. His impact is largely determined by the skill of the people who didn't pick him. That's not healthy.

> there are too many things in his kit that feel VERY unique, to the point that having him in the game at all REALLY changes the dynamic.

This is forsure spot on. This ties heavily into why he is hated. People hate Syndra because of her R doing lots of damage even if she misses Qs, Fizz because of his Troll Pole on E.. Trynd cuz of his R, Rengar 1 shot from stealth, Morgana for her Q snare duration etc.. Everyone has 1 spell that just makes them super frustrating to play against, healthy or not its a big part of the champion.. But as you stated Yasuo has A LOTTTTTTT of things that people find frustrating and feel very unique to his kit.

> His impact is largely determined by the skill of the people who didn't pick him.

Even some of the better Yasuo players can run into games where they just simply feed. It's the nature of the champion right now. He averages the 2nd highest deaths per game according to http://champion.gg/statistics/#/roleSort=Top&sortBy=general.deaths&order=descend?sortBy=general.deaths&order=descend Which feeds right into the feast or famine of the champion.

I just really hope riot doesn't change this champion so much that the Yasuo player base no longer finds him appealing. I myself don't really dig the new Rengar nearly as much, and it wouldn't be fair to the Yasuo community if something similar was done to him. Yasuo should keep his Fluidity no matter how they decide to change him.. Making a champion clunky is just a bad way to balance them in my personal opinion. Aside from that, i cant imagine them somehow turning him into an assassin /or/ tank ;) haha

his hidden power in E, you basically have to play with the assumption that yasuo can always dash to you and can always dash away from you because it isn't shown to you which minions he has used E on or what the cd on them is, that's a lack of clarity which in turn gives him power, hidden power, imagine brand his passive being invisible on minions, that would also be hidden power.

Ability by Ability

Q frequency in-lane is kinda a sore point for me. The low CD causes a few issues in-lane.

1) Ability to farm from "range." Its not exactly far, but it does mean any melee champ that wants to harass has to walk up into his creep wave to do so, and any ranged champ has to walk into the middle of their creep wave. (Easy dash distance)

2) No window of opportunity to take advantage of CD. Kinda self-explanitory, but basically by the time you say "His Q is down, time to fight" its back up.

3) More manaless ranged poke and CC than is really reasonable. Yasuo Q tornado is ~10s at lvl 1. (a little less if you run AS runes, a little more if you don't) It seems a little strange that a melee carry has ranged poke on a CD nearly the same as Lux, a poke-heavy champion. And Yasuo's CD drops down to 4s with an item. And to be blunt, an AoE knockup every 4s is a heck of a lot of CC. Like most supports don't have that much CC, hell, most tanks don't have that much CC in their entire kit. (See also: Riven)

4) Has caused that awkward problem where a late-game hypercarry has amongst the strongest early lvls in the game.

Scaling down to its current lvls seems... okish to me, but having it start that low baseline means that Yasuo is spamming away without a care while his opponent has to always be mindful of their CDs/resources. After all, its not like Yasuo would have to wait on CDs if you ever waste a spell.




Lets be blunt here. If your champion is reliant on projectiles with a reasonable CD, windwall is basically a hard counter. The fact that its instant means that the only way you can play around it is to hope that Yasuo either A) Doesn't react in time. B) uses windwall on some spell, doesn't take advantage of the fact that your spell is on CD, waits for your CD to be up, then puts himself in a bad position again before windwall comes off CD. Its also a little weird to have such a powerful utility spell (one of the best) on a melee carry champion. Oh, and blocking minions/monster projectiles is actually a lot of power.




E needs to have some window of vunerability. Right now it has the same issue as Kat Shunpo had, you can use E to gapclose for harass, but its basically immediately available to retreat as well, leaving your opponent with no chance to return damage. This is a BIG part of why laning vs. Yasuo isn't fun. He's free to engage on you at basically any point, but will still have his mobility spell up to escape if he gets ganked or takes a fight he will lose. (See also, LB)



I'm actually pretty OK with his ult. The towers thing is a bit weird, but whatever. One big thing though 80 / 55 / 30 CD. ignoring the 30s R3 ulti (really, why?), 80s is low for a R1 ultimate. For referance, Riven's ult before 2 nerfs was 75 / 60 / 45. Current Riven ult is 130 / 95 / 60.

I just see him as a champion that is compensated too much for being "melee". Fiora and some others are in this situation, where they're always too good or not due to heavy compensation that makes them frustrating to play against.

To some degree I agree, he has a lot of defensive tools. But despite having all those defensive tools, even in higher level of play, he averages the 2nd most deaths per game of any champion.. and some patches the most. http://champion.gg/statistics/#/roleSort=Top&sortBy=general.deaths&order=descend?sortBy=general.deaths&order=descend

The issue with this clearly shows his kit is Feast or Famine. He either gets so far ahead these defensive become overwhelming, Or he becomes so far behind, they are practically meaningless.

His feast or famine side is partly due to difficulty and champion select playing a heavy factor into his success. He loses pretty hard against some top/mid laners, with others just being heavily in his favor unless the Yasuo lacks experience. If there were to be consistency he would have to have some pretty big changes.

I think match up is probably the most influential part of this. Some match ups he can just dominate from lvl 1.. and others, {{champion:58}} .... are a freaking nightmare.

I think experience has a lot to do with it, but probably not as much as the match-ups.. Hell i've seen some good Yasuo players feed simply due to the match up they were given. It's like, even if they don't feed early, the match up never gets any easier.

I know this might sound stupid at first but i think Yasuo needs to become MORE of a generalist, and less of a Specialist. And as you said, he's going to need some changes to get that consistency. 

What kind of things could help with this consistency? Well the first thing would probably be to address the specialties.. the things everyone hates and then figure out which ones could become less special. Personally, I think someone else mentioned how his stats are simply too low for a fighter, and its largley due to all his Specialties, as i'm stating here.. So perhaps with a happy-medium, he could find that consistency.

Personally, i think his W is too special, and that would be the first thing i looked at, as he can impact so many champions with it. Hurting W would help him be stronger in the other areas of his kit. Without actually making them busted.

His mobility is beyond frustrating, the double passive is insanely irritating and the windwall cast hitbox is so enormous good luck playing any mage against him because his windwall cooldowns match your strongest spell ones.

I really do think of Yasuo as a cool character, but haven't even played him in a very long time because his kit makes very little sense to me, given his theme. Here's why.

#1. Yasuo is an obviously Oriental character made with heavy emphasis on Wind as an element, but his uses of Wind  CONTRADICT the Oriental concept of Wind:* Wind is fleeting and swift, always in motion, never still (it does not exist when there is stillness).

In context of this, Wind gathering around Yasuo to become a shield [passive] makes no sense whatsoever. Heck, it doesn't even decay when stopped in place (as redundant as that would be). If anything, Wind should be his resource because Wind is something that comes then goes. Not something that comes, stays and hangs out, and hardens to protect from bullet and blade alike as a shield [passive]. His long-term stationary wall that somehow selectively blocks only enemy attacks [W] only makes a bit more sense. How is it not blocking his own team's? Why does it last for so long? 

#2. Wind is Yang in nature- it can be gentle, but it can be very forceful. What connects these two is speed. More speed -> more force. Yasuo, however, doesn't actually scale off movement speed or attack speed in terms of hitting harder: he just gets faster like everyone else.

In my opinion, he should be more like Jhin. Getting movespeed or aspd increases his attack damage, not his actual attack speed. This way, his base attack speed can be altered to be smoother from the get-go and his attacks can be powerful sword-strokes without the unnecessary crit doubling. Yasuo even wields a katana. He really should be more focused on selective killing strokes rather than a death-by-100-cuts style of combat.

Now his Q E and R, I feel are in a better place. Q shouldn't get free cdr for aspd imo, and the tornado shouldn't cc targets with knockups for longer periods than our newly reworked tanks' knockups (sej, mao Qs). On the other hand, it's a skillshot that can be combined with E to perform a different action which is very cool and it's the main damage of his abilities, so the damage from it isn't too big of a deal.

E is limited by enemy presence, so it has a good limiter as it is. The problem is when the passive / W are combined with this insane mobility.. but Wind cannot be tied down. It makes more sense to tweak the passive and W than to adjust his mobility by much.

R is also conditional, and gives Yasuo a blink + cc and teamwork oriented combinations that I feel are good to work with. However, the cooldown is absurdly low and his free armor pen really shouldn't be free. The armor pen should scale with crit (IF crit doubling is removed) or movespeed / aspd.

He is a light fighter. Light fighters have a lot of mobility but aren't supposed to have easy access to the back line, forcing them to kill the tanks and bruisers first. Yasuo circumvents this ultimate makes it easy for him to dive the back line. Possible fixes:
 - Shorter range on tornado.
 - Remove the shield.
 - Reduce the damage and funnel that power somewhere else.
Note that we can't suddenly consider him a diver or assassin because if he was his E would have to be nuked from orbit.

A large part of Yasuo's power is invisible stat boosts that are impossible to see without reading Yasuo's ability descriptions. His E has a stacking mechanic that I'm pretty sure the vast majority of his players have no idea exists. His ult gives only his critical strikes 50% bonus armor penetration. I don't have a problem with the latter because light fighters should value safely attacking tanks over killing squishies. Possible fixes:
 - Make it more clear what's going on. I'm not sure how to do this though.
 - Remove the need to stack E and just keep a lower base damage. Its primary purpose should be as a dash, not a nuke. The E stacking doesn't add counterplay, just more damage when Yasuo gets to you.
 - Remove the armor pen on the ult and move tank killing power elsewhere on his kit. I like to play tanky champions and I would unironically be okay with his crits dealing some %health damage because it reduces his ability to kill squishies.
I'm not even going to touch the turret thing. That's disgusting Riot throw it out. If I genuinely have to go into further detail on why that's unacceptable then I should really just uninstall and go play something else.

Late game Yasuo's ultimate has a shorter cooldown than Karma's ultimate. Karma's ultimate is supposed to basically be one of her regular abilities and Yasuo has six seconds on her. (Karma's is 36s late game, Yasuo's is 30s late game.)

The fucking wind wall. This is the major thing that needs to be looked at. Anyone who doesn't know what's wrong with it at this point is probably a Yasuo main or a closeted Yasuo main. So many possible fixes have already been given. Being able to walk through the windwall isn't counterplay. Yasuo deletes squishies. If you walk through the windwall you are melee with Yasuo or even if he would still lose he can use a dash to get out in many situations. It shouldn't delete ultimates with a 30 second CD. His passive already helps blocking poke so I don't see why this was necessary on his kit in the first place besides making certain champions unable to properly play against Yasuo. Wind wall lasts for 3.75 seconds at rank one. For reference, Azir ultimate has about four times the cooldown and lasts .75 seconds shorter. Braum's shield is the crux of his character and it only reaches the same duration as wind wall at rank four. Basically anything you do that makes this ability worse will make Yasuo more fun to play against. Keep in mind that Yasuo also has a dash for every single minion in a lane to dodge poke too, while also being manaless, so there's never a point where he needs to leave lane if you don't poke him out.

Everything in Yasuo's kit works for Yasuo. He has one dodge-able ability, his tornado, other than that he's just a ball of stats to the people he's playing against. It's not any different from Xin Zhao, it just takes better execution.

All of this and I've only dipped slightly below the iceberg of this champion's problems. I don't think the small update is going to be enough but I'm glad Riot's giving it a shot. Lee next please.

Pretty sure Yasuo's most hated ability (and rightfully so imho) is Windwall. I am 100% with people who think it lasts too long... it does. I also think it gets too big. Fix the size, and it's easier to play around. Shorten the duration, and it doesn't lock people out for whole team fights in tight spaces.

How to go about buffing him is difficult until you fix what's "annoying". Windwall is really the only  thing for me. His double crit is his only real damage steroid. If you remove it, you have to compensate in some other way. 

Personally, I think he should still be a crit champion. So he either needs to have increased crit chance or increased crit damage. Double Crit chance is one way, but if you do increased crit damage, he needs a way to access it outside of buying 100% crit chance. This is because he is melee, and as a carry will be relatively squishy.  In any case, crit should be a thing on Yasuo.

He needs to remain mobile. It's core to his theme. I think adding clarity by showing which targets he has dashed through would be good. I've heard it argued it may clutter the screen, but I'm not sure I agree with that. Yasuo sees it, and we see vitals for Fiora, so we can play around it right? Should be same for Yasuo opponents.

I personally don't think he needs the crit damage reduction ( on q yes, but not on his autos) as it simply makes him deal less crit damage than other crit carries, but from melee, which is inherintley riskier.

Hope RIOT succeeds, but I feel like he will be banned in low ELO regardless.
